All Reviews

  1. First off, I didn't buy this replacement blade. I have a 8000 3D and needed new blades, the price of these was so high that I thought I would try the new 93xx razor. I like the razor AND THE RAZOR HEAD (SH90/52) FITS THE 3D RAZOR! So you can save 20 bucks and get the other replacement blades and they would pretty nicely.
  2. Fast delivery and works perfectly.
  3. I am a longtime Norelco user. I have used Norelco for almost 20 years now. Over the years, I have owned 3 Norelco shavers and they were all good. This shaving head is the best I have used.<br /><br />Why is this head so good? It shaves closer than any other head, including the original RQ-12. It also shaves fast. It shaves areas which I had trouble shaving such as the stubble right beneath my nose with no issues. What else would you want in a shaver?<br /><br />Some reviewers have complained about the noise. Yes, it does have a higher frequency buzzer sound. But who cares? This is a shaver, not an audio.<br /><br />Some reviewers have complained that it it pulls too much hair and it hurts. I suppose that's possible if you have thick AND LOT of beard. But then again, if you are such person then practically every shaver will hurt little more just because there is lot more plucking and shaving going on. For me, this shaver is not painful at all.<br /><br />Some reviewers have complained about the plastic head. Hello, this isn't an iPhone. Do you really care whether your shaving head is plastic vs metal? If you do, then in my opinion, you should start worry about something bigger like your health, retirement plan, and global warming etc.<br /><br />Bottom line: this shaving head shaves closer and faster and can cut mustache in areas where the previous RQ-12 was deficient.<br /><br />Pros:<br />1)Shaves close and fast.<br />2)Can shave areas where the previous RQ-12 was deficient.<br />3)Norelco claims this shaves 30% better than its predecessor, and I believe it.<br /><br />Cons:<br />1)Not cheap.<br />2)All the negative reviews on this shaver head, in my opinion, are unwarranted.
  4. It fits and works. It is larger and cuts differently. Had to relearn the shaver.
  5. This replacement head is absolutely terrible. I was very happy with my purchase of the Norelco razor with the original heads and now I feel like I've been ripped off. The new head feels terrible and sticks against your face. The blades don't shave as closely as the old head and they constantly pull at your hairs. I ended up getting more irritation than I ever have in the past. This truly is a terrible product and its bad enough that I'm considering getting rid of my Philips Norelco and replacing it with something else.
  6. With all of the bad reviews I was concerned about having to purchase this RQ12+ replacement head for my shaver. I was pleasantly surprised that it shaves just as well as the old RQ12. It is clearly a different design and the cleaning operation is different as well, but I haven't found cleaning it to be any problem at all. You just pop the top off and rinse it. Reading the instructions is worthwhile.<br /><br />The reason that I gave this product 4 stars instead of 5 is that I think it is way too expensive.<br /><br />By the way, once you have this redesigned head on your shaver, you can buy just the replacement cutters and combs in the future. This is Phillips product SH90 and it is a bit cheaper than buying the complete replacement head. I haven't tried this product yet - just putting it out there as I didn't see it mentioned in other reviews.
  7. Since I could no longer find the RQ10 and Norelco says this fits that series, I bought it. It fits, as they say, and seems to shave well (first try), BUT a caution in &#34;fit&#34; should be noted. With this larger head, the shaver will no longer fit in the travel case/charger. You have to take the head off to charge it or travel. UPDATED REVIEW after 214 days of use, alternating with my old RQ10 for travel. The RQ12+ is the worst of the Phillips/Norelco heads I have used in the last 30+ years. This should be brought to the attention of management and engineering. Someone really missed the boat. I will not buy another one. In the 214 days since I bought my RQ12+ head, I have used it 136 times. The other days I have been traveling with the RQ10 head that was more than a year old when I bought the RQ12. The following comments are therefore based on using the old (worn) RQ10 36% of the time, altering with the RQ12+. 1. The results are very clear. The RQ12+ gives you a 5 o’clock shadow by noon. Yes, there is a clear, 5 hour difference in closeness. A few times I’ve had to shave again in the evening. 2. There is an extra millimeter o so between the cutting area and the outer edge. This makes it much more difficult to shave close to the nose and ears. 3. There appears to be too much flexing in the floating units, as it requires much more facial expressions and stretches to actually cut. Without a good convex mirror, varias hairs are left long. 4. For whatever the reason, the RQ12+ requires going back and forth many more times from different angles and directions, taking between 150 to 190 seconds per shave, vs the 65 to 85 seconds for the RQ10. For what it is worth,that is 6 hours a year. But it also means an extra minute in the morning routine for getting ready for work. And, as noted above, the shave is still not satisfactory and by noon will be very noticeable. 5. That extra time means less time between charges. With the RQ10 head I can (and have) easilyextend a trip from 2 weeks to 3 without having brought the charger. I don’t like to take the charger as it is one more thing to remember when packing to return home. And anyone who doesn’t have the RQ10 charging case would have to take the fragile stand. Was this change made for cost reasons? I have to doubt that, as you sell it for a lot more than the RQ10. I will give credit for the easier snap off blade assembly for cleaning that you have on the RQ12+. But at this point I have to think about the day my heads wear out. I will NOT buy another RQ12 head. If you haven’t fixed the problems I will probably start trying the Chinese knockoffs of the RQ10. They are poorly rated on most reviews, but can’t be worse than the RQ12+. Maybe someone will get it right.
  8. Noticeably closer/better looking shave than the older design RQ12 head. I have used the older RQ12 heads for at least 4 years and enjoyed them on my Sensotouch 3D. The new design shaves quieter and much quicker than the old style head (the last one I had kept on the razor for probably 16 months... because of other people's poor reviews on the new design). I liked the flip-out cleaning of the older head style, but this new one is still pretty simple to clean daily. The new head does a much better job of trapping/holding the shaved whisker in the head. The old one made quite a mess all over and I had to be very careful to be over the sink while using it. Overall I am quite pleased with the new design's performance.
  9. Horrible on explicative all downgrade in quality of shaved and comfort from Norelco. I managed to pull two years of effortless and smooth shaving with the original RQ 12 heads that came with my 7100 unit the 3d head as it was called. When it came time to purchase a replacement head I noticed that people were selling them for as much as $300 but that Amazon said a new item this item the plus version was now available. This is by far the most surprising thing to happen in modern retail with which I can agree and I'm a part of. I've had a Norelco since early high school and every several years I would purchase a new or model and now over a decade latermy streak of satisfaction with Norelco has ended. This is not just a case of me whining and saying the razors aren't as good. They are genuinely bad and I've even given them more than a month to &#34;&#34; adapt to my face. They miss hairs that aren't even some of my course or hairs on my face andgrasp and pool at hairs that are more than a day or two old. I found that my shaving time has gone from as little as two or three minutes to nearly 10 minutes to get my whole face as I have to repeat areas with increased precision on my part.<br /><br />I've always had sensitive skin on my face and razors were very troublesome for me and the early Norelco models were even worse that would cause very painful razor burn and rash however these are more expensive models that I purchased in my 20s were we noticeable improvements with features as indispensable as using with cream as needed or in the shower and most importantly a smooth shave that doesn't require repetitive motions over the same area and essentially beating The time it took me to shave with a razor blade and getting pretty much just as close without the need of going against the grain and risking ingrown hairs.<br /><br />I am genuinely frustrated because I can't handle a beard it makes me very itchy after about one week and once again I'm stuck with a shaving method that is extremely irritable to my skin and as a medical professional I have to stick to either clean-shaven or carrying and grooming the beard<br />Which May be fine for plenty of guys out there but it doesn't look good on me and I don't find that to be an alternative to not shaving. I really don't think I should pay $300 to third-party sellers to get the original replacement blades when I got a great deal on Amazon in the first place of only $140 for the entire shaver with the jet clean system.<br />I've done my part leaving a very negative review about what is truly a negative product it's not an opinion it's as you will see from plenty of other men this is truly a step down as nobody would buy a replacement part unless they have already used the product with original parts. They are less comfortable, less efficient, painful in some instances, and not as dissectible as the previous version where you could take apart the heads individually quite easily hear the pop off connected and you must manipulate a plastic lever. Also you can't focus in on the save the mustache area using a single head as I was used to as Norelco may claim this new model has more motion I find that to be simply a lie as I still have the original head and it is much more flexible and has greater contour to your face.<br /><br />Having finished up my Amazon review I recommend you do what I did and contact Norelco support asking if they're willing to sell you the old model and when they say they discontinue it express your dissatisfaction and reference the fact that not only on Amazon but other consumer sites the product is receiving very negative reviews but even when you take the average the product is ratedmuch lower than his predecessor. And these are never off those higher end models this is the kind of stuff that is great for companies like Braun
  10. Finally I could get a new head for my razor.<br /><br />Everyone ran out of the RQ-12. I searched high and low. Not only could I not find the head, I could find an explanation for why no one had them except for crazy $169 type prices.<br /><br />Finally this head shipped and all became clear. RQ-12 has been replaced with this upgraded yet perfectly compatible head!<br /><br />I've always had trouble finding a shaver that could handle my fine gossamer thin hairs all the way up to my wirey ape thick hairs along my neck line. The RQ-12 was good but this new replacement head is AWESOME!<br /><br />Well worth the wait but I could have been happier if there had been some transparency on the upgrade process.<br /><br />Bravo for making my shaver instantly much better.   11. Based on the many negative reviews here about this item I was really concerned that I would not be happy with this shaving head. I ordered the RQ12/62 anyway thinking I might end up buying a different shaver if it didn't work well for me. With quite a bit of doubt about the quality and functionality of the product compared to the original RQ12 that came with my Sensotouch 3D, I used the RQ12/62 for the first time today and must say it was great - at least as good as the original head and probably significantly better. It was a very close shave, smooth, no tugs or pulls as reported in many reviews. I only use the shaver with gel and maybe that's why my result is so good. Possibly dry shaving with it is not as good, but regardless, with gel is the way I use it and am extremely satisfied. The cleaning after the shave is simple and fast - different than the RQ12 but easy nonetheless.

It makes shaving easy again. It's easy enough to clean. This experience makes me doubt the persnickety reviews of this and many other products I read about on line.   47. This head is a cheap replacement for the RQ12 original head. The three cutter heads used to fold open on original RQ12 model and allow you to easily clean both sides of the razor head. With this replacement model you have to pry it off the razor head to clean underneath. I used to get a years use out of the original RQ12 razor head. I have only used this one for four months and the razor is already signaling that it is time to replace the head. It does not shave as smooth even with careful care to clean the head after each use. Value Engineering (a method to redesign products and take cost out) strikes again. Considering that you pay about $200 for the original system and about $50 for each replacement head, this has gotten to be a real rip off. I looked at the new razor design at Costco yesterday and it is the same cheap design as the this replacement head. No Thanks! I will be looking for a new brand to replace this piece of junk.

I haven't had any issues with the plastic construction as others have. Overall, I think this is a good replacement head.

  55. I purchased the RQ12+ replacement head for my Arcitec razor. I bought it because it was advertised as a RQ10 upgrade replacement. It works so much better than the RQ10, smoother on the skin and the ability to rotate the cutting heads, and open completely to empty cuttings and wash out easily. The cutters pivot on two planes which keep the cutters against the skin continually and give a great shave. A honest upgrade to an already great shaver.
  56. A sub-par replacement for the original SensoTouch shaver head (the original one where the 3 blades actually popped open for easy cleaning). I am extremely disappointed with Norelco. I had been a loyal customer for a long time (I have purchased 4 Norelco shavers over the years), and was delighted with the performance of the 1250x when I bought it; the shaves were close, comfortable, and cleaning was easy - simply flip open the 3 individual blade housings after my daily shower-shave, rinse under running water (in the shower) and once a week, run it through the cleaning station -- all was good. Then around the 12-month mark, it was time for the head to be replaced (very early in 2014)....and when I went to order a replacement, I saw that the price of the heads was astronomic, both on Amazon and elsewhere....all $100+, often reaching even higher, absolutely ridiculous levels! Searching the internet quickly made it obvious that Norelco was no longer supplying those heads, and they had left their loyal customers to fend for themselves against opportunistic sellers and their crazy price mark-ups (read \\"gouging\\"). Now that is one thing any company worth an iota of common-sense will not do....to not have replacement components instantly available for a highly rated product that is designed for periodic part replacement. And then to add insult to injury, when they FINALLY do start supplying replacement heads again, it is with this sub-par head! It does not flip open for easy/thorough cleaning, but more importantly, it does not shave anywhere as close as the original RQ12 heads. When I first got this replacement head, I thought that maybe it needed a week or two of \\"breaking-in\\" before coming up to snuff (by the way, the original head that came with my shaver needed no such breaking-in and shaved very well from Day 1), but nevertheless I gave this replacement head the benefit of the doubt. But much to my dismay, I realized that it wasn't going to get any better, and that it shaved no better than my 12-month old original (and now worn) head. So after first feeling let down by Norelco around the lack of reasonably priced replacements for the better part of 2014, and then the sleight-of-hand of replacing the original with a cheaper replacement (but with no commensurate reduction in price to match the reduction in performance), I have concluded that I am ready to part ways with Norelco shavers. I am hearing great things about the Braun 799cc wet-dry shaver, so am on the lookout for an upcoming sale so I can finally switch over.
  57. If you get a good shave with this POS replacement let me know. I just threw out my Norelco 3D and cleaning apparatus and went back to my Gillette. What was I thinking!

  61. I purchased the RQ12 replacement heads for my SensoTouch 3D. The R12 replacement head is $150 and the RQ12 was only $50<br />While the RQ12 do work, its design is poor. Cleaning the RQ12 involves opening up the head, removing a cheap plastic ring and cleaning the blades. Cleaning of the R12 is much easier. Moreover, because of the design of the RQ12, all hairs are captured inside the head, it makes the need to clean the heads more frequent.<br /><br />I am unlikely to replace the RQ12 heads next year with similar blades and do to the cost of the R12 replacement heads, it may make more sense to replace the entire unit with a newer model.<br />When I pick a new electronic razor --I will pay more attention to the cost of replacement blades.

  66. Was a long-time user of Norelco rotaries, then Braun and Panasonic foil, then DE razor, now back to Norelco. I previously used a 1280 and 1290x, and this replacement head provides a shave that is better (for me) in comfort, closeness, and speed compared to the older flip-top, as well as being easier to clean - pop off the top plate with the heads, rinse shaver and heads under hot water, replace. I didn't follow the negative comments about cleaning - rinsing the plate with hot water does a very thorough cleaning job on these heads, and fewer hinges, springs and wires compared to the flip-top (in fact, none) to get clogged up with gunk while shaving. You would likely never remove them individually except to replace them - something you couldn't do on the older Norelcos. These heads cut closer and with less irritation, and are quieter as well; comes with the plastic head guard and removal tool. A quality replacement.

  72. Used this to replace my old head, and yes, it is different, but I have to say it really is working better than my old blades providing a much closer shave (then again, the old blades were about 5 years old). It does come apart for quick cleaning, just remove the blades from the head using a notch at the top and rinse the entire blade compartment under hot water. It came with the little orange contraption to remove the blades for heavy cleaning, and it does work well. Is it durable? I can't answer that as I have only had it a few weeks, but for the price, I think it is well worth it and I am very pleased at this time.

  74. The controversy over this replacement head caused me to prolong replacement of my original as long as I could. I really stressed over buying this because of all the negative reviews. I'm happy to say they are completely unfounded. I have a difficult to shave face and I loved how the other blades moved and always gave me a close shave. This new head gives me an even better shave in less time and is much easier to clean. Granted, the support material for the blades is made of plastic which ended up having no bearing on the performance of the blades what so ever. It did make the shaver lighter, which is not a bad thing in my opinion.<br /><br />The level of detail and machining that went into the the old style did give the shaver a step up in perceived value, but at the end of the day it really comes down to how well it shaves your beard right?   75. I really don't understand all the negative reviews for this product. The head that it replaces, the Norelco RQ12, was gimmicky and fragile. It also looked expensive to manufacture, which undoubtedly led to Norelco replacing it with the RQ12+. I get a much better shave with the RQ12+. In fact, it is the best shave I've ever gotten with an electric razor. I switched to blades years ago to get a closer shave without irritation but got tired of cutting myself, sometimes quite badly. I decided to give electric razors a try again when I found that I could use this Norelco wet and with shaving cream. Yes, I have to go over an area several times but I find that with a lubricating shave gel I can get a shave as close as a blade without irritation. With the original RQ12, I would still nick myself occasionally. With the RQ12+, I've never had that happen. Don't believe the haters. This replacement head is fantastic!
  76. I was a little disappointed that they made this cheaper replacement model which works almost as well and costs more now. Not quite as easy to clean and after a month I really don't think I can get as good of a shave dry as the old model. Wet shave is as nice as the old one though.
  77. I found these new blades in the modified head to be superior to the original. They are easier to clean by simply pulling the top off of the head and brushing out the whiskers. This was harder with the older head. The shave seems quite close, but this could be due to the fact that the original blades were a year old when the razor said they needed to be replaced. I saw others have complained about this new style, but I see nothing to complain about. I have to be careful and not lose the tool they sent to remove the blades from the head, but other than that this seems to me to be some improvement. My only complaint is to why they are so expensive.

  79. I've had an Arcitec shaver for several years. I thought it was a very good shaver, but upgrading to the RQ12+ head was amazing. Shave time is improved by at least 30%.   81. I have been very skeptical of buying this product due to the reviews of the item on this site. I have put off buying a new shaving head for my Norelco 1290X shaver for that very reason. I purchased the shaver in December of 2012 and have not replaced the head until now. Silly me.<br /><br />The review: All that I can say is WOW! I have long since forgotten what a close shave was until installing my new heads. Now I remember why I was so excited to get my Shaver. It actually shaves better than when new, if that is possible. I have a very tough beard, and had resorted to going back over my face with a trimmer type shaver after I was through shaving with the Norelco. No longer necessary. And as for the cleaning of the new head........again........WOW! Super easy and super effective. I never got close to my shaver being this clean, even when using the Jet Clean system.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this head for anyone with a shaver that utilizes this model. It is like getting a new shaver every time that you change heads. I have no idea how long this head will continue to perform like this, but compared to my old one, it is light years ahead of where I was after 2 and a half years.
  82. I initially chalked up all the negative reviews to disgruntled customers that couldn't deal with something being different. This is Norelco after all and I've been nothing but pleased with my shaves up until now; especially with the 1250X, to date the best electric I've ever used. Then I received the RQ12+ as a gift and realized how very wrong I was.<br />The hair pulling, the sandpaper closeness, the poor hair pickup, the increased passes, the longer shave time; it's all there and as described by hundreds of other reviews. I particularly noticed that it was virtually incapable of shaving my neck, no matter how many passes at whatever angle and approach I made. The final nail in the coffin for me, was after 3 weeks of poor shaves, I stopped halfway through my latest and put my old RQ12 back on. Even with 11 months of usage on it, it shaved remarkably better and quicker than the RQ12+<br />So, give this RQ12+ a try if you must, but my recommendation is to use your original model until your face bleeds and then seek out a whole new electric. Personally, I'm taking a few years off from Norelco when my original RQ12 gives up the ghost.
  83. I'll keep this short because others have already repeated the basic points I want to make. This new replacement head is a piece of junk. The heads and the rings that are supposed to hold them in constantly fall out of place. They're small and hard to reinsert, even though I did my best to follow the microscopic instructions. They don't properly lock into place, and they can easily get lost. The previous replacement head design was far superior, but I guess these new ones are cheaper to manufacture. I've had enough frustration though. I contacted Norelco twice but they were no help at all. I will see what Braun or Panasonic have to offer. Like others have said in their reviews, I only wish I could rate this zero or negative stars.
  84. much worst then the old and original model. Do not reccomend.
  85. Do not like the RQ12+ as much as the<br />RQ12 that was on the shaver when I purchased it.
  86. More than I expected, works great
  87. not as good as the original
  88. I read through all these reviews and very nervously bought one of these replacement heads, because there's no better alternative. And while I share the concern that swapping in different replacement heads to a product like this is not a great practice (one of the reasons i bought this razor was on the expectation there would be decent replacement parts available), i have to say that when all is said and done - the replacement works fine! There's lots of reviews to the contrary so maybe i'm an outlier, but this new head works great for me, it's quiet, easy to clean, and i notice no change in the quality of the shave.
  89. What a scam - The original RQ12 head was perfect this is a cheap version that performs poorly.<br /><br />This is bait and switch from Norelco, you buy the razor with a superior head and the only replacement is sub par. I've been a customer for life, but this makes me ask why.
  90. Don't let the naysayers say otherwise. The new head which is a replacement for the old RQ12 head and also fits a new series of high end shavers from Norelco, works very well. The head design is different, but the shave quality is as good or better than the old original head that I had on my shaver, which was the original RQ12 head.<br /><br />Many reviewers are claiming that this shaver head is unsatisfactory, however my advice would be similar as if somebody was transitioning from an old electric shaver to a new one, or from blade shaving to electric shaving. As with any new shaver, you have to give your face and skin a little time to get used to the new cutting head. Shave slowly, don't apply too much pressure and be gentile, at least until the blades and screens are a bit broken in and your face is also conditioned to the new heads.<br /><br />Unlike the old RQ12, the new head is two pieces, no more individual opening shaver heads. The bottom piece is the geared drive unit which mates up with the shaver power handle, the upper piece holds the three shaving heads. The three shaving heads move independently, same as the old RQ12, however they seem to have more axes of motion. An orange &#34;wrench&#34; comes with the replacement head set which allows you to unlock the individual blade from the foil head for removal and cleaning. This is unlike the old RQ12 in which each blade head flipped open on a hinge. That is actually the biggest structural difference between the two heads.<br /><br />I also have the automated cleaning system and this head works find with the wet automated cleaning cycles. The head is also quieter than the old head.<br /><br />All in all, this is basically an improvement to the shaver, without having to go out and buy a new shaver. Norelco has had the forethought to provide older shaver owners a built in upgrade to the shaving technology on their newer shavers by virtue of selling current shipping replacement heads to older shaver owners.
  91. Philips Norelco can take there products and shuff it up there royal asses after raising there regular RQ12 razor $200 plus!!!
  92. I needed a little help to understand how to install the new cutting head but all is fine now
  93. Waste of money!!! My one year old blades cut better.
  94. I initially did not purchase the RQ12+ after reading many of the negative reviews. But then I decided to try it after reading a good point raised by one of the reviewers regarding the fact the RQ12+ head comes with the new shavers but that no one reported any issues?? I received my new head last week and I'm getting a nice close shave. It's hard to compare between both heads when you have the new head (RQ12+) but only a 'perception' of the experience with the original head (RQ12). Perhaps it would be more objective if someone performed a comparison test using both heads when they are both new, RQ12 and RQ12+. It could very well be taking me longer to shave using the RQ12+ as oppose to the RQ12. Hard to say since I bought my razor over two years ago and did not use the razor for 8 months because I did not buy the RQ12+ due to negative reviews. Bottom line, it might take me a few minutes longer to get a close shave than the original head, but I'm Ok with the time factor...the important concern for me is that I get the close shave...which I'm getting. Perhaps Norelco could have made an improvement to the RQ12+ over the past few weeks or months just prior to my purchase??
  95. Ignore the 1-star reviews; this &#34;+&#34; version is far superior in performance to the original RQ12, to the point where it is as good as a regular razor blade. The only drawback is the head, to be cleaned, comes off entirely and has to be air dried. The head isn't &#34;cheap&#34; in any way, but a major, major improvement that has allowed me to stop with manual shaving.
  96. The product was exactly as represented.
  97. I'll echo the many other 1 star ratings for the Norelco RQ12+--it just doesn't shave nearly as well as the original blade, but what's a guy to do? My wife thinks it is strange I have 5 different shavers in the medicine cabinet because none of them shave well in all areas. Each of the 5 shavers is the top of the line for Panasonic, Braun, and Norelco. The Braun is a good dry shaver but doesn't shave as close as either the Panasonic or Norelco. 15 years ago the Panasonic gave an incredible shave--quick and close. Then they changed the tolerance on their replacement heads as has Noreclo and neither shave as close or fast. In fact, with this new Norelco RQ12+ replacement head I have to go over and over and over an area from different angles to get the smooth shave I want. So I can still get a decent shave, but it takes twice as long and isn't as good as the original shaving head. I also tried a Noreclo 2D head and it shaves about as well and is a lot cheaper.

  102. Anybody who claims this head is better than the original is somebody who obviously never used the original. I feel cheated that the head design had been discontinued and never would have bought the razor in the first place if not for the flexible head design. The original head spread and flexed to keep good contact on my skull for a nice quick shave that gave a clean bald look. This substandard cheaply made head, despite being brand new and supposedly top of the line, doesn't work nearly as well as my well used 2 year old original style head. The original design glides over my skull, actually cutting the hair. The junky feeling replacement head sticks to my skin and is laughably deficient in cutting hair- leaving strays all over the place that I have to hunt for so that I can spend 10+ seconds trying to get this head to shave them off. It takes almost twice as long to get the job done now compared to the old head design, which I thankfully kept. A complete waste of money- a bait and switch ripoff as far as I am concerned.

  116. Excellent result. Specialy when using wet. I have been using Philips shavers for 54 years . This new shaving head suites me well. Great close shave.
  117. The Sensotouch 3D razor is the best razor I've ever used: comfortable, easy to clean, and extremely quiet. But I was dismayed to learn that the old RQ12 replacement heads (with the three flip-up covers) were no longer available--other than from gougers who are charging two or three times the normal price. I was way overdue for a replacement head so, despite some negative reviews, I was forced to order the RQ12+. But when I got it, I was pleasantly surprised! The RQ12+ is as easy, if not easier, to clean as the old design. You just lift off the top, run it under hot water and shake it off. The head snaps on with a tighter seal than the old design so the razor doesn't leak whiskers onto the counter while you shave. But the biggest improvement is that the edges are narrower and tapered downward. The old design had a wide, flat border around the circular heads, making it very difficult to shave the area immediately below the septum (middle of the nose). The negatives are not too bad, in my opinion. The razor is still quiet but I would say just a touch louder with the new head design. The new v-shaped cutters are a tiny bit less comfortable for the first few weeks, but now it feels fine and my shave time is reduced. All in all, if given a choice between the old and new design offered at the same price, I would select the new design, though I would be happy with either one.
  118. Better shave and it seems to use less battery power
  119. This should receive negative stars. The head is a garbage plastic knockoff of the previous head - compare the two, it's very apparent.   131. I purchased the RQ12 Plus to replace the more than 1 year old RQ12 head in my Philips Norelco Sensotouch 3D shaver. Once I replaced the RQ12 with the RQ12 Plus in the shaver, I noticed a significant degradation of shaving performance. The shave I got was uneven and not nearly as smooth. There is nothing Plus about this version. It feels very cheap and should be more properly labeled RQ12 Minus. Wet shaving with shaving gel was the only way to get a decent shave with the RQ12 Plus. I have since removed the RQ12 Plus from the shaver and reattached the older RQ12 head.. Despite having been used for more than a year, it provided a much better shave. Knowing that the lifespan of the RQ12 head is not unlimited and not willing to spend $180+ for a new RQ12 head ($254 on sale at the Norelco site), I have opted to purchase a Braun 790cc-4 shaver for about $150. This is my first Braun purchase and am very happy with its shaving performance. I had been a longtime customer of Philips Norelco but I believe they have lost me as a customer with the very poor design of the RQ12 Plus.

  159. After all the horrible reviews and poor performance on a previous Norelco shaver, I was concerned about using the RQ-12+ replacement head on my 1260X. But I gave it a try and was pleasantly surprised. It no longer has the flip out heads, but shaves a little better and is much better in containing all the stubble, which used to spray out all over the place. The entire head now snaps off for cleaning, which is not a big deal. I find that I now rinse it out after every shave. On first start up it was a little noisy, but after a couple of shaves, it seems to be a little more quiet than the old swing out system. The kit did come with the orange wrench, should I want to more thoroughly clean the heads, or if I want to replace just the cutters and screen in the future. I found the construction quality to be similar to the previous design, with no more or less plastic parts. All in all, I am satisfied with this design. I would have given it 5 stars except that I think that over $50 is still a steep price for a replacement cutter head,

  170. Well I decided to take a chance after reviewing a lot of the reviews on both sides. This was a replacement for my Sensotouch 3D with the original RQ12 head and I always wet shave.<br /><br />Pros: This does give a nice close shave as good as the old RQ12 only if you shave every day.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />1. Cleaning is more cumbersome than the original. Not that great a deal but it simply is, the original you just flipped the blades up and washed under hot water without having to worry about scalding your hands. This one you have to pop the whole head off to wash, your hands will get hit with hot water while rinsing.<br /><br />2. If you are the kind of person who may skip a day or two then it doesn't come close to the quality of the old head and takes twice as long to get a close shave. When daily shaving though no issues and as good as the original.<br /><br />3. It's definitely more flimsy, lower quality. The parts came apart very easily when I gave it a quick flick with my wrist to get rid of excess water after cleaning and ended up in pieces all over the tubs floor. This of course ended up with me sending it back for a refund because if you get the blades out of their original placement in the head you will get degraded performance per their documentation.

  173. Works as expected. Great shaving system. Norelco recommends replacement every year. I find replacing every six months is better with my (heavy) beard.
  174. In theory, this should be an improvement from the old RQ12. It pivots on more axis than the old RQ12. The individual blades can be removed and replaced instead of throwing away the entire head, like the old RQ12. The individual blades are less expensive than the old RQ12 and the RQ12+. So once you own the RQ12+, you can spend less and buy the 3 individual cutters.<br /><br />However the big issue with the RQ12+ is the quality of the cutters. Initial shave with a brand new RQ12+ is awesome, 5 stars. A closer shave then I ever got from the old RQ12, which worked great for me. The old RQ12 could cut through my beard of steel exceptionally well for about 6 months before needing replacement. The cutters stayed sharp enough to give a smooth shave without discomfort and after 6 months it was worth the cost to replace.<br /><br />The new RQ12+ stays sharp for about 3 weeks. Then it's garbage. The benefit of more flexibility on it's axis is far out shadowed with it's ability to tear out hair or just skip over hairs without cutting. Norelco designed a better head in the RQ12+ but lost all quality control with the cutters. After years of Norelco use, this is my last one. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THESE!
  175. Terrible replacement. What is wrong with Phillips Norelco r&ad department. If this is the best they can do, I will be switching to Braun.
  176. Very smooth shaving head.
  177. Almost a month now and so far working just fine since the day I 1st used it. I just found out that when its time to replace I can opt for the SH90 replacement blades. Its a good thing that I made sure that I kept orange tool that will allow me to replace just the blades and not the full enclosure. I will see if I could send another review after at least 6 - 12 months of use.
  178. Thank you received fast and secure.
  179. I'm a long time user of Norelco shavers and really cannot compare with others since it has been a long time since I used any other. I'm extremely satisfied with this product.   180. Much better design , thanks

  184. Sharp and easy to clean.
  185. easy to clean shaves very close, nice!
  186. I have been using this new RQ12+ Replacement Head for my Philips Norelco 1280X/42 SensoTouch 3d Electric Shaver for almost 3 weeks now, shaving every other day. First, their claim of a 30% closer shave is an overstatement. I find that it shaves about the same way as the original RQ12. As for noise, it is not as noisy as the RQ12 was when I replaced it. But it is very possible that just as with the original RQ12 the RQ12+ will get noisier as it wears in. However, the noise when it starts cutting into the beard is louder, more noticeable. The big difference from the original RQ12 is when you remove the top to clean it. It feels flimsy and cheap. I am afraid that the water flowing out of the faucet might knock it out of my hand and damage it. The plastic rings that hold the cutters in place looks very thin. Feels like it could break at any time. Update 03/06/2015 I am adding a star to this Norelco Replacement Head. In the month I used this new replacement head I had no irritation on the neck.
  187. Orange retainer ring falls out each time head is taken apart to clean. I see no way to get another ring (s) set of 3 rings is to return the entire head.

Isn't it supposed to be the leader in this field? Guess not. I'm going to change shavers over Christmas. Braun, here I come.

  192. Horrible. Decided to ignore the negative reviews and give this product a shot based on the quality I'm familiar with from Phillips Norelco. I regret that decision.<br /><br />First, this is actually a Norelco product, not a knock-off. It comes in the correct packaging, sealed, etc.<br /><br />Took it out and had my first shave with it this morning. I ended up putting the old head back on to finish my shave because it was THAT BAD. It doesn't make good contact with your face. The razor pulled hairs out instead of just cutting them, making for a VERY painful shaving experience. It missed hairs consistently. I'm pretty sure I'm a contender for &#34;Best Freddy Krueger Costume in February&#34; given the amount of times I had to go over certain areas try to get the hairs. There are actually spots that I gave up on because I just couldn't bear to go over the spot again. The head sounds like they just put rusty gears in the head, as the thing is loud and sounds scary.<br /><br />I'm upset that I've now paid in excess of $300 on a razor I do not feel comfortable using anymore. Thanks, Phillips! Way to protect that bottom line!<br /><br />If you're thinking about spending the money on this head because you already spent the exorbitant amount of money on the shaver itself, please do yourself a favor a do a google search for &#34;sunk cost&#34;. The only reason why I didn't give it a 5 star is that I agree with some people about the build quality. It does feel cheaper than the original head and is louder to me.   219. I purchased these replacement heads reluctantly after reading through the many negative comments concerning the revised design. But I was also curious to see the changes and evaluate for myself. Well, the replacement heads are a significant improvement over the original design. The improvement I appreciate the most is how they have made the heads easier to clean. The top pops off as one unit and is easy to clean out as compared to the original heads that each opened separately. I wish I had ordered these earlier because they perform much better than the original heads. I don't understand all the extremely negative reviews referencing plastic. As far as I can tell the heads are identical to the original heads with the only difference being the improved ease of opening the unit for cleaning. I think the negative comments must be coming from paid reviewers from other razor manufacturers or who have some other bone to pick with Norelco.

No way you can get a year out of them and I do not even shave every day. This one is a bit harder to clean because you have to remove the heads from the plastic frame. The original, you just popped it open. Not a big deal but slightly different. I does seem a bit noisier but not to extreme. I haven't had this one long enough yet to see if it stays sharper for a longer period of time.

  229. Well, I gave it a try. All the reviews were negative, but what else could I do since I already owned the 8000 series razor. No RQ12 available for purchase, so upgrade I did. Not an upgrade at all. It randomly pulls while cutting and doesn't give as close a shave as the RQ12's that I've purchased in the past. Also, the cleaning instructions are much more involved and difficult than the RQ12; once a month you have to remove each blade and clean it separately. Only you have to do one blade at a time, because they are fitted to the associated head; mix up the blades and you spend some time with painful shaving - this according to the instructions. Also, every shave, you have to detach and clean the head, then leave apart the head from the body while they both dry. The RQ12 flip open drying was so much more convenient. Bottom line, you have to upgrade sooner or later - no other option that I can see. So Norelco seems to have it figured, market is captured so why not increase profit margins by putting out a lower quality product for the same price. Disappointing may be time to try a different brand. Someone should start a class action lawsuit - if only I was a lawyer. UPDATE : I switched back to my 1 year old RQ12 and the difference was amazing - even after a year of use, my RQ12 is nite and day in terms of closeness and comfort compared to the new RQ12+. The RQ12+ reminds me of the old arctic razor I bought a long time ago, same razor burn, random pulling, and stubble remaining after a two pass. When I updated to the 8000 it was like I'd found nirvana; I ended up buying it as gifts for relatives, it was so excellent. I really hope Norelco brings the RQ12 back into production, else I'm going to keep this old blade as long as I can then start hunting for a new razor company.

  238. People are adverse to change, which is why I believe the reviews for these replacement blades are so low in comparison to those of the new, top-of-the-line Norelco shavers. In my own opinion, these blades do provide a closer shave, perhaps with a bit more pulling, but not with any real discomfort. For those who complain, go try Braun's top-of-the-line shaver. Not only will there be stubble all over your countertop, but more than likely, you'll draw blood. Norelco shavers are easier on the skin, provide the closest shave possible and are pretty easy to clean. These blades are cleaned differently than the original equipment, but they are still pretty easy to clean and to keep clean. But why did Norelco change the design of their blades so drastically? The answer is simple - it's one of cost. It probably never made much sense to continue making a different set of replacement blades for every model of shaver they've ever made. As these blades have gotten more and more expensive, however, the need to cut costs has become much more evident. Who in their right mind would pay $100 for a set of replacement blades for a shaver that costs $200 to buy new? By standardizing on a single design, Norelco can cut costs dramatically, keeping the price much more reasonable, even though it is still fairly high. By standardizing on their latest design, we all benefit from the latest technology. The Arcitech was a disaster of a shaver that couldn't handle more than a day's worth of growth. Now, those old shavers will benefit from the newest design.
  239. I bought this 2 months ago and today one of the rotary blades just fell out and now it is not usable. I paid $58 for this, so a real waste for only 2 months use.
  240. This is by no means like the blade you received with your new Razor. Check the other reviews, mine went dull within two months. My other blade which I bought this one to replace. Is much sharper now and is over 2 years old. The Shave only last a couple of hours before I need to re-shave. Why Norelco is selling this as a replacement is insulting to everyone who is tricked into buying it.

  266. I really like the RQ12+. I have been using it for about a month on a SensoTouch 1255X. Also, I am now wet-shaving with the SensoTouch 1255X with RQ12+ head and get a much closer shave than I previously did with a dry-shave. (I have found that liquid hand soap lathers fine and I do not need to buy shaving cream or shaving gel.) Because of negative reviews from others, I was reluctant to buy the RQ12+ head and I also was miffed at the very high price of new RQ12 heads. However, I found that the RQ12+ works great and the price of $46.99 is reasonable. There was some confusion in other reviews and questions about the RQ12+ versus SH90. The RQ12+ is a complete head assembly that contains the cutters, combs and holder. SH90 is the replacement cutters and combs without the holder and can be used only after the original RQ12 head has been replaced with the RQ12+ head. The SH90 can be used in future replacements instead of buying the complete RQ12+ head assembly. The RQ12+ also fits and works well on my older ArciTec 1050X. The RQ12+ head is larger than the original head and must be removed from the razor body if you are using the Power Pod charging unit with the ArciTec. - June10, 2015.
  267. I have the Norelco sensor touch 3d and this head is the new replacement for that shaver. The old blades are no longer available. This new blade has bigger blades, you can feel the cut get closer to the skin with very little effort. It was easy to replace, just pull old head off and pop new head on and shave.
  268. At first I thought it wouldn't fit but yes it does. Easier to clean too so pretty happy. Very quick delivery also so overall a success. Close shave as expected I should also mention.
  269. Purchased these to replace the RQ11 on my Norelco shaver. Not much better, plus they are more costly. I find that i am having to make several passes to get a clean cut. Once these wear out, i will just by a completely different brand of razor.
  270. It was easy to replace the head. It seemed like it worked OK for the first week but afterwards the cutting ability was significantly reduced. Unlike some others who have posted positive reviews about this head, I didn't like the design. The heads flop around and makes it hard to shave under nose and other such crevices. I also have to keep going over my face multiple times to get a close shave. I never had to do this with my original. It is also a more bulky replacement. I don't like at all that Phillips changed what I felt was a winning design. I liked the ability of opening each head and cleaning it now I have to disassemble the entire flippin' head to clean it. That's not the original design that I paid for and they changed it for the worse. Effectively this makes my shaver useless now as I don't intend on buying inferior replacements like this for $50+ dollars. I don't know what they were thinking but I kind of feel a little ripped-off. I returned the head as it is pretty much useless and has increased my shave time by about 50% and without a close shave that I got with the original head. What a shame. Phillips, are you listening?
  271. I bought it a s a replacement for my razor I have had for two years now (the razor not the blade head). I replace them every 12 months. It is a different design and although it seems to be better, I am not convinced it shaves a well (close) as the older unit I replaced. All in all it gets the job done.
  272. I read all the negative reviews and I don't agree at all. This is a quality product. I am 100% satisfied with the shaver head.
  273. These blades do not provide as close of a shave as the ones they replaced. They also became much duller after just a few months of use. I'm getting tired of purchasing Norelco razors that fall short of expectations. I'm now looking for other alternatives.
  274. After all the negative publicity I was worried this was going to be a bad buy but in the end it was more like a neutral buy...I agree with negative reviewers that the RQ12+ is definitely a lower quality head than the original RQ12, but on the other hand my personal experience of its shave quality is there is very little difference between it and the RQ12, even after having used it for several weeks. Of course anyone else's mileage might vary depending on beard type, shaving style etc etc, but I found nothing to complain about as stridently as some other reviewers, other than that maybe it runs slightly less smoothly across the skin, though not so much that I would consider it a problem. And I certainly don't see it being inferior enough to make it worth paying scalper prices for one of the few original RQ12s still on the market. On the other hand, it's pretty clear that the RQ12+ must be a significantly cheaper to manufacture head than the RQ12 - it has fewer parts to it, and just seems lighter and flimsier. So the redesign was undoubtedly for the benefit of Philips Norelco profit margin and not for the consumer, who still gets charged the same price as before, hence only 3 stars.
  275. Okay product for after market
  276. I liked the previous style much better. Cleaning was way easier. No instructions came with the replacement as to what to do different. Confusing for an old fart !
  277. not as good as the blades that came with the razor. these come off as one piece.

The original RQ 12 replacement head sells for $188 on Amazon, discounted down from $289. Not real good economics when considering the cost of a new shaver is ~$230-330. Looks like I am headed back to a close shave the old fashioned way, shaving cream and razor blades.

  297. This truly is a disappointment. It gives a decent shave so far (1-2 months), but as others have complained the housing around the blades is made of cheap plastic that catches your skin instead of sliding smoothly over it even when wet (The original head housing was made of metal and glided smoothly over my face). It kind of rattles like cheap plastic and the blades squeak if I press them too hard on my face, even when they are wet. That never happened with the original. I am really shocked that this is now the replacement head for an expensive shaver. I only bought it because I haven't found a decent replacement shaver at the same price point as the replacement head. I gave it 3 stars only because it still gives a good shave. Otherwise, I would have given it 0 stars if possible.

I was better off continuing to use my old blades, but unfortunately I had already thrown them away.<br /><br />My suggestion is to use your old blades as long as possible and buy a new razor.   329. I ordered this as a replacement for my Arcitec since the original heads were being fazed out. I was a little hesitant because of all the negative reviews. But I am quite pleased with it. It only has two instead of three shaving tracks of the arcitec, but I feel like I am getting a closer shave in less time. The whole head is slightly bigger than the Arcitec so they tell you to remove the head every time you set in in the charging travel case but I found that I could trim back some of the foam inside the case and so it sits fine now for travel. I also find it easier to wash than the original head that opened from the inside out in three directions. I'm quite happy with it.
  330. Seems to work after waiting almost a year past the replacement time due to its unavailability.
  331. First of all, I have a Norelco Arcitec razor that uses the RQ-10 replacement head. Last year, the RQ-10's were about $33.00 here on Amazon. This year, the same head is $83.00 +/_ a dollar or two. So I went looking for a new razor and ran across a You Tube video of the RQ-12 head being used on an Arcitec razor. It is a direct replacement as far as fit goes, but is far superior to the RQ-10. The RQ-12 has larger cutting surfaces and the head articulates in 8 directions, giving the head superior comfort. The very first shave was very smooth and close. This head was much less than the RQ-10 (by at least $25) and gives a better shave. If you have an older Arcitec Norelco and don't want to toss it out or pay $85.00 for a replacement head, try this one!

  359. I haven't actually purchased the RQ12+ yet, so I cannot intelligently comment on actual shaving performance (e.g., closeness, degree of pulling, etc.), but I'm somewhat disappointed in the design differences I've so far noted from the original, and I am TOTALLY disgusted by the price gauging I've been witnessing for the original RQ12. In short, the RQ12+ is not the shaving head of my birth. The unique features available in the original RQ12 (now absent in this &#34;newer&#34; model) are part of the basis by which I chose the SensoTouch 3D in the first place almost a year ago. Now I'm coming up on the time to replace the head, and, based on what I've been reading, am fairly concerned that the overall shaving experience is not going to be at all the same as I've come to expect, effectively rendering my SensoTouch 3D into an entirely different shaver that I neither purchased nor wanted. For one thing, RQ12+ doesn't appear to pivot around the face as did the original. And, personally, I couldn't care less about the ability to take this new head completely apart down to the fittings. One of the nice things about the original RQ12 was the ability to simply flip up the covers and rinse, virtually eliminating the need to take anything else apart. Given the price point for which the RQ12 *originally* sold compared to the price for which this newer version is selling (i.e., they were about the same price), I'd sooner replace the entire head than to fiddle around with some plastic orange tool. But of course this entire discussion would be academic if we could simply retain the choice to purchase original RQ12 for the same price instead of the (ridiculous) $199.00 for which it is currently being advertised as of this writing. In the end, I have this nagging suspicion that the RQ12+ is something that was more designed to cost less for Phillips to produce rather than to improve over the shaving experience of the original design. In any event, I think I might start shopping for a new electric (not a Phillips). If the shaving experience is as different as what's being described by others, I might as well.

  377. This is bigger than the RQ-10 it replaced. It fits in the pod only without the protective cover, and it is a tight fit. Instead of opening the way the older version did, the piece that holds the blades comes off, sometimes when you don't want it to, like when it's being rinsed. It does clean easily. The shave is about the same as the older one. Overall, I like the RQ-10 better, but it's not worth the premium price since it was discontinued. Since I reviewed this, my experience has changed. The plastic parts are flimsy and came apart one morning while I was shaving. It took me about ten minutes to it back together. Today, it was making noise while I was shaving, but it was working. When I removed the blades to clean them, the orange cover for one of the blades came out. Apparently it was loose and that is what was causing the noise. I would not recommend buying this if you can find the RQ-10 at a reasonable price. I think I will look for a third party replacement next time.
  378. This new head the company released is terrible. It is not nearly as smooth and tends to pull more often. The original head provided the best shaving experience! Why did you do this!? I am buying a new razor now because of the RQ12+. Do not buy this head if you can afford to get a different razor all together.
  379. It's good but not as good as the original head that came with it when it was new. It's now plastic instead of metal.<br />Also if you should drop it and it all comes apart, putting it back together is no walk in the park.

  394. Different? Yes. Shaves just as close and as good? Yes. As I often read these reviews to purchase products from Amazon I thought I would write this one for those on the fence about the new RQ12+ replacement shaving head. After reading the reviews on Amazon I almost purchased a new Braun shaver for $200 instead of replacing my Norelco 1250X head with the new RQ12+ shaving head for $47. The RQ12+ has gotten a lot of negative reviews. After receiving mine and using it, it shaves just as good if not better than the older RQ12. It may look cheaper or feel more plasticky but don't let that fool you. It really gives a good shave and after using it a few days I actually feel it is easier to clean. The whole top of the unit that holds the 3 blades pops off with little effort and you can actually rinse it more efficiently than you could the RQ12. So, if your on the fence about ordering one, order the one directly from Amazon for about $47 and give it a try....what do you have to lose? Anyone paying $180 or so for the old head isn't gaining a thing. Give it a try and see what you think.
  395. This RQ12+ head is not the same as the original head of the Norelco Senso-Touch 3D razor. It has been highly downgraded! Rather than the 3 tracks it had before, it now has 2 tracks, one for shaving short hairs and one for the long hairs. The original head has 3 tracks, two for shaving the short hairs and one for shaving off the long hairs. The price for the head has doubled over the last seven years or so. I have always purchased Philips Norelco's best shaver, but the priced on it keeps going up and up at a too rapid rate! So, I'm sad to say that I am done with the Philips Norelco company and their razors. I don't know why they have downgraded their products, but after many years of using Norelco razors, I'm leaving them for a better alternative! I used a Braun electric razor 42 years ago. I'm going back to them. I just purchased Braun's most advanced model for much less than the most advanced Philips Norelco razor, and on the first shave, it does an excellent job in a much shorter period of time than the Norelco Sensotouch 3D. Goodbye Norelco, and hello Braun! I am another ex-Norelco user due to the quality downgrade and greed of Philips Norelco.

  402. My family had used Norelco for generations vertically and across the same generation horizontally. After we saw that the RQ 12+ DID NOT EVEN HAVE 3 TRACKS, THE OUTER TRACK WHICH OF THE SEVERAL SLOTS ON THE OUTER RING, THE 2ND LEVEL inward are THE LARGER GAPS WITH TEETH AND THE 3RD LEVEL WERE LITTLE HOLES IN THE MIDDLE RING FOR STUBBLE as the box displayed.... We saw that the RQ 12+ (12/62) did not have the 3 tracks WHICH THE SENSOTOUCH 3D HAD, that which the box seemed to allude to the shaver being MARKETED BASED UPON. THIS 3-D ASPECT IS WHY WE SWITCHED TO THE 3-D SYSTEM IN THE FIRST PLACE AND IT IS WHY I PAID THE EXTRA $100 for the 3-D instead of the 2-D! Now I have been forced to switch to a 2-D model (2 dimensions of cutting) and had paid the extra $100 along with the thousands of other individuals who bought these shavers which seem to be a bait and switch !! Norelco had made, in the 3-D system, the best shaver I had ever used and it was because of the shaving head and the design by which they had manufactured this excellent tool for a man who cares about being well-groomed. This worked for me as someone who cares to present himself as best he can to the world around him, not for notoriety, but because it makes others feel comfortable, who know that a man who cares about himself without pretension, will likely care about others. I am amending my post in light of what Roy below, taught me regarding the ACTUAL meaning of 3D vs 2D. I thought it meant the # of different style cutting perforations in the surface of the head, but it alludes to the x,y,z axes which the shaver moves along. Thanks Roy. I give the RQ12+ an extra star because the dimensions of movement are WHOLE SHAVING HEAD, WHOLE SILVER RINGS ENCIRCLING INDIV HEADS PUSH IN FLAT AND 3rd, THE INDIVIDUAL HEADS WITHIN THE RINGS TILT WITH YOUR FACE AS WELL. Norelco made in the 3-D system, a great tool with which to do this comfortably without a red face from sensitive skin because of the way the original RQ 12 (12/52) glided so easily and conformed with ease, as it bent in multiple directions, to meet the contour of the face like no other electric razor ever had. I have seen the reviews of other people regarding this cheaper model, 2-D shaving head which is so much less effective and satisfying than the original 3-D system which we all paid for to use with the extra $100 plus!! Instead of ripping us off any further, Norelco needs to begin manufacturing the 3-D head again, the RQ 12 (12/52) so that we get the shave that we paid for originally. My family bought these razors and this is the last generation, unless Norelco makes a very smart decision to give us what we actually paid for.

  418. I got this as the replacement for the RQ12 shaver head for my SensoTouch 3D.<br /><br />The unit is slightly different. Rather than the top flipping and hinging upward to clean, the whole top half of the head lifts off. It comes with a plastic tool so you can take apart the blades/combs, unlike the original unit.<br /><br />Overall it seems you would be able to clean the blades much better than the original RQ12, although it maybe isn't quite as convenient.<br /><br />The shave with this new head is very nice. It definitely feels smoother and gives less irritation, although the fact that I'm not using a brand new shaver head over the old original certainly makes an impact.<br /><br />I only have 1 minor, but irritating complaint. The head seems to hold water inside of it, but it doesn't drip out until the individual shaver heads have tilted some. So basically while shaving, if I rinse it out, it holds the water in, then I start shaving and the water just drips out all over the counter, over myself, etc. I've tried moving the individual heads around with my fingers some before I start shaving - it will get some of the water out, but still leaves a lot behind. It is kind of annoying but I think I can live with it.

  421. I have had the new RQ12+ for several months now and have waited to make sure that this product is given a fair review. This is a great replacement to the original RQ12 razor head, which has been discontinued. All of the complaints about poor quality, tugging on your beard, loud noises, the razor losing its sharpness after a few weeks, etc. etc., is simply not true. In a nut shell, here are the &#34;Joe Friday&#34; facts:<br />Pros: 1. Very sharp blades. 2. Excellent pivoting action of each razor head, despite the fact that the three heads are seated as one unit on the pod. Each blade assembly pivots quite well and independent of each other. 3. The blades are very sharp and remain sharp even after three months of use with a heavy beard. 4. Cleaning is easy and more thorough then the previous RQ12 head. The entire 3-blade assembly unit pops off to be cleaned under hot running water, then simply snapped back on. 5. The blades are very sharp, resulting in no pulling or tugging. If there is pulling or tugging of your beard, you are using too much pressure. A light touch is all that is necessary. 6. The sharp blades and excellent pivoting action result in a comfortable shave and smooth skin. Hint: Use Williams Lectric shave.<br />Cons: 1. A little more noisy than the RQ12. Why? Because its cutting more hair. 2. A little cheaper looking plastic. 3. No more hinges on the blade assembly for cleaning. You must now remove the entire head assembly, but this means the cleaning is now more thorough. The cosmetic issues are relevant to a great shave.

  430. I bought this replacement head because my 1280X (8000 series) was indicating it was time for replacing the shaving head, and it did feel like the blades weren't cutting quite as well as they used to. That when I found out that the RQ12 replacement head for my shaver was (basically) unavailable, and I would have to order the new RQ12+ head. I was a little skeptical because of all the bad reviews, but I figured I need to try it myself. My facial hair is probably medium thickness, and a little on the coarse side. It's definitely not the coarsest or thickest hair. It also doesn't grow in all that fast (~2 days for an appreciable amount of stubble, 4-5 days to start looking scruffy - I usually shave at 2-3 days). I am strongly considering switching back to my &#34;worn out&#34; RQ12 shaving head. I find this shaving head to be rather uncomfortable by comparison, and I'm not sure the shaving results are worth it. Cheeks: This is where the RQ12+ is doing best. It's still more uncomfortable than the RQ12 - after shaving an area several times and feeling it to make sure there is no hair left, if I run the shaver over the same patch, it's still a little uncomfortable, as though I can still feel the guides scraping my skin to find something to shave. However, it is also getting a little closer shave than the RQ12. Neck and jawline: The RQ12+ is giving me abysmal results here. I have to go over the same patches 8-10 times to get most of the hair, and the entire time I feel poking and tugging from the shaver. The RQ12 also had issues in this area (required repeated passes to get the hair), but was significantly more comfortable. Upper lip: With the RQ12, I could make two passes across my upper lip to get most of the hairs, and then use the pop-out trimmer to handle the hairs left near my nose. With the RQ12+, I just can't seem to get anything resembling an effective shave except just above the corners of my mouth. Overall, I am pretty unhappy with this replacementhead. The shave quality is mediocre except in easier areas, and it's uncomfortable in every area. I don't know if it's because it was designed for their new 9000 series and just doesn't work well with the 8000's (in which case either continue producing the replacement head for the 8000's in sufficient quantity, or flat out tell us that the RQ12+ isn't supported for use with the 8000 series, rather than telling us this is the new replacement head for our shaver), but if I received a new 8000 series that was using the RQ12+ head, I would return it and look for a different shaver, because it is so uncomfortable.

  459. I like the RQ12+. It works well; I've been using it for about one month now almost daily, and I have no problems to report.<br /><br />I use this for shaving my head (not my face) and it does a great job ... and dare I say it ... a slightly better job than the previous head design. The caveat is that I have to be more precise with how I hold and maneuver the shaver. With the old head, it was possible to be really &#34;sloppy&#34; with my shaving technique and I still got a good shave. Now, with the new head, I have to be more precise, but I'm rewarded with a better shave.<br /><br />It should be noted that when I shave, I lather up my scalp with a nice shaving soap. I find that I get a much closer, smoother shave than if I don't use any soap.<br /><br />Problems, complaints? None, really. I thoroughly rinse the shaver and head before and after every shave, and very rarely pop the top to clean inside. When I do, the inside is quite clean anyway, so a quick rinse and then the top goes back on. I have yet to remove the blades for a &#34;deep cleaning&#34;.
  460. It works great, easy to clean.
  461. I'm not impressed. The RQ12 gave a better shave faster and smoother. The blades on the old RQ12 did wear out after a year, but the RQ12+ doesn't shave nearly as well as the RQ12.
  462. In July 2013 I bought the Phillips/Norelco Sensor 3D 1250/46 for $180. Out of the box it did a pretty good job and was/is very quiet. I decided to buy the replacement head RQ12 for $47.33 on 5/18/15. All purchases were through Amazon which handled the orders perfectly.<br /><br />I am now looking to go back to a regular blade. Understand that I do not have a heavy beard that requires the razor to work extra hard. However, I still have to make multiple SLOW passes just to get a somewhat close shave. Sometimes I still have to &#34;touch up&#34; with my cheap Trac II that I use for close trimming.<br /><br />It is a real shame that to buy the exact original head that came on the razor to begin with, we are made to spend close to two thirds of the original purchase price. I've owned Norelco wet/drys for many years. My main complaint has always been that they all grow noiser with time and use. If I could justify the cost of a Braun I would buy it today. I'll never go back to Phillips. Think three times before you buy this product. It simply is not worth your money.

  468. 1 of the orange inserserts in shaver came lioode and i can't get it back in place ..am only using three blades.
  469. a greatly cheapened head replacement; i sent it back. this is a real step backward for Norelco.
  470. Bottom line: This replacement shaves as good as the original RQ12.<br /><br />So why then did I only give it 2 stars? Because it only has the features of a 2D razor---the heads move only in two directions (the 3d moves in three directions) and the combs have only two openings to trap whiskers and hence the actual cutters have only two rows of blades while the 3D has three openings to trap whiskers and the cutters have three rows of blades. I bought a Sensotouch 3D razor and paid more than the 2D model but now I've been downgraded to a 2D model! Another complaint is you need the special tool (included) to remove the combs with the cutters inside. Lose the tool and you're SOL when it comes to a thorough cleaning.<br /><br />UPDATE 9-1-15.<br />After 2 months of continuous use these heads are about as &#34;sharp&#34; as the 2 1/2 year old original RQ12 head they replaced. After 45 years as a Norelco user, I'm switching back to blades. Norelco has lost a good customer!<br /><br />There is one advantage to the RQ12+ over the original RQ12 (besides price)...you can just order the combs with cutters and save about $10 over purchasing the entire replacement head.<br /><br />But here's the kicker---the RQ12+ gives me a shave every bit as close as the original RQ12. In other words, for me there is no real advantage in purchasing the more expensive 3D model over the 2D model, other than bells a whistles.<br /><br />A quick final note---I have been a regular Norelco user for 45 years. I have a box full of razors going back to the original two comb &#34;floating head&#34; model. Some of you might remember the TV commercial with Santa riding the razor head and floating over the snow.
  471. The reviews on the old RQ12 3D head being much better than this replacement are entirely valid. This head doesn't shave near as well as the old head and leaves stubble and long hairs that have to trimmed. It is marginally easier to clean but that is about it. Norelco built an Edsel with this shaver head.

If I skipped a day on the weekend I would have to use a trimmer first, or the blades would leave about 5% of the whiskers uncut. But this blade catches even those longer whiskers and I get a nice shave even on Monday morning.<br />One issue I can confirm is that these blades have a wider outer frame, so they are not able to get as close to my nose, and I have to trim that area with the trimmer.

  498. Ok let me start by saying I too was very weary getting a replacement set of blades based on the review. But I needed a new set so I did it. TOO CLOSE&#62; When getting near the upper part near the cheek where those strays are I could actually feel the blades passing over my skin. Now if you are skinny and have thick tough skin that is not malleable to the blades you may not feel it. But my skin is well cared for and soft so its moves very well with the razor. I literally feel like I have razor burn!! Now will it calm down and will I adjust? Better or worse time will tell but for now it does work.<br /><br />Everyone else:<br />Ok heres my thing, companies change, things change. You don't get pissed off at car companies, coffee pot makers, hell clothing makers for changing something, you don't boycott them for sure and swear you will never drink coffee again or wear clothes again right? Get real! Those reviews are nonsense. Yes it may be not as nicely built in the sleek and stylish fashion you are accustomed but does it do the same job or better? Be Honest. key word honest. Some people don't like change obviously but overall it performs the same job with a little more closeness than the previous one and that works.

  506. When I first put it on the razor I noticed it did not shave as well as the &quot;worn&quot; head I was replacing. After a few months of trying to learn to like it, I put the old head back on (RQ12, NOT +). I found the old head still shaved better than the new one and I will use that until it no longer shaves me satisfactorily. Then I guess I will have to switch to another shaver as this replacement head is not acceptable. Poor shave, not close and it pulls hairs. I spoke to tech support at Phillips and they seemed to be aware of the issue but said that corporate has not announced any plan to fix the issue. One post said the newer cutters from the current razor will fit the RQ12+, but the tech guy tried it while he had me on the line and said they do not fit. So for now the razor is useless once the original cutters wear out.<br />UPDATE: Dec 2015- As mentioned above I put the original head back on, planning to replace the shaver once that head was no longer working. On checking the reviews for various shavers I noticed the Norelco reviews, especially for the RQ-12+ changed after about Dec. 2014 and were more mixed. The more recent purchasers seemed more positive by a margin that made me believe a redesign must have taken place. I decided to give it one more try before chucking the shaver and ordered another replacement head. Both the new RQ 12+ and the old one look the same to my eye, but the shave is night and day different. On first use my impression was &quot;I got my favorite shaver back!&quot; as it shaves like it did when I first bought it. Not sure what they changed, but after two weeks with the new head I am convinced either they improved the design of the RQ12+ or my previous one was defective. Either way I am pleased with the head now and have upped my rating- it would be higher, but I want to see how long this head lasts. If it makes it a year I will be most pleased.

No, it doesn't look the same. Since it is for the later high end shavers it is a &#34;3D&#34; head and floats better than the original arcitec head. It also came with a little tool to remove the cutters for better cleaning.<br />I saved almost $100!
  552. Very good product. It's totally compatible with my RQ1050 and give it a new life. The original line head of this model never shave me very good, the RQ12+ is quite better. I even don't need to use aftershave as it doesn't irritate the skin like the old model. Highly recommended product!
  553. terrible. the original RQ12 was awesome. This RQ12 + is a cheap horrible excuse for a razor replacement. Phillips is just not what it used to be, time to switch brands.
