  1025. Apparently Norelco states this is a replacement for the 3D SensoTouch. I want to emphasize &#34;3D&#34; and not 2D.<br /><br />Why I say this is because the 3D SensoTouch allows the three heads to move freely from each other. It's kind of hard to explain, but the 2D model allows the heads to tilt inwards and had a solid outer shell/housing that did not allow them to separate from each other.<br /><br />When I bought the 3D SensoTouch model, this was the feature I liked most. It lets the heads split and move/tilt outwards and inwards. With this new replacement head model, you are actually getting the downgraded edition. So you basically downgraded your 3D model for the 2D model.<br /><br />On top of the above shady tactic, the shaver head is just not good, plain and simple, which is really unfortunate. I get a worse shave and more tugs with this replacement. This was an expensive mistake and now I may to leave Norelco altogether since I don't have a replacement head that's not garbage to buy.
  1026. I have to change my review: initially I didn't like the new replacement head. I have to admit it is far easier to clean and the shave is just as good. It's plastic instaedvof metal, but it gets the job done.
  1027. Philips Consumer Lifestyle (U.S. vendor for Norelco shavers) should continue to make BOTH the original RQ12/52 and their newer head RQ12+ (or RQ12/62) available for users of SensoTouch 3D.<br /><br />Many careful users of the superbly made SensoTouch 3D top-of-the-line 1290x find that the original RQ12/52 head GLIDES MORE SMOOTHLY (especially over sensitive neck areas) and has LESS PULLING or TUGGING than the new replacement head. I have carefully evaluated both heads on the 1290x, and that is also my conclusion.<br /><br />Also note that the original RQ12/52 had THREE tracks in each of the three circular heads (including the tiny holes in the center track for stubble). The new RQ12+ has only TWO tracks in each of the three circular heads, including the new V-channel outer track. There is no inner track of tiny holes for stubble.<br /><br />PHILIPS (Philips Consumer Lifestyle)--Are you listening?--Make BOTH of these heads available for your SensoTouch 3D customers. And let the customer decide which head is preferred. Don't FORCE them to use the RQ12+!

  1034. Compared to the previous version of the original Q12s, these new razors are a lot worse than expected.   1035. I bought this replacement head with a lot of doubt given all of the negative reviews. Because the 1290x shaver that I have is by far the best shaver I have ever owned, I had to give it a try. This head is different than the one that it replaces in several important ways. First, I think that this shaves even closer than the previous model (however I am replacing an old head with a new one and the gradual degradation of the old head may account for the difference.) Second, the blade section flexes more than the old head, the head section no longer flexes. This change does not bother me at all since it has not affected the comfort of my shave and as mentioned above the shave is closer. The third major change is that the three heads no longer swivel up for cleaning, but instead come off as one unit. It is possible that this may aid in cleaning, but I have not noticed a difference. My preference was for the blades swiveling up which allowed me to store the shave as one unit while drying, now it has to be stored with the shaver unit as always and blade section separate. I considered removing a half star for this, but it is not possible. Another important factor to consider and other reviewers were quite helpful in pointing out is that there can be a tendency to pull or tug a little -- by applying slightly less pressure, the pulling or tugging stops. If you are an Arcitec owner, this is a huge upgrade. I use my old Arcitec as a travel shave and had previously changed the head on that to the old RQ12. It was not advertised but it upgraded that model to effectively be a Senso-Touch 3d. Now Norelco advertises that the new RQ12+ is compatible with the Arcitec. Finally I have also learned from the package insert and confirmed with Norelco that SH 90 replacement blades can be used in this head unit saving between $5 and $10 for the next replacement. I find it interesting that the new 9000 series using the same cutting system has received excellent reviews whilethis product has received so many poor reviews. UPDATE 11/28/15 -- Rating lowered from 5 stars to 1 star. After 10 1/2 months, the head stopped working properly and shrieks without turning two of the three spindles. It sounds like a gear broke inside. I called Philips and escalated to a supervisor. This call was a waste of time. Philips will do nothing about their problems other than offer a 15% discount (still more expensive than the undiscounted Amazon price). They are aware of the negative reviews (even lower on their site), but insist that this is a superior product and are not willing to make good. After being a Philips Norelco user for more than 40 years, it may be time to change. When a company is unwilling to stand behind their product, why should anyone purchase that product?
  1036. Very disappointing.This replacement head is a real cheap version of the previous one.<br />I doubt that I will continue use of Norelco razors in the future.
  1037. It doesn't seem to shave as well as the original. Also, it seems to be less well made.
  1038. What a fine example of &#34;don't try to fix what ain't broken!&#34;. Philips, I'm so disappointed in you! The RQ12 head was a beauty, an absolute masterpiece of a shaver head. The new head (RQ12+) is just the opposite. It's a very rough shave and pulls of hair to the point that I can't use this head when I haven't shaven for about 2-3 days. With the RQ12, it was a breeze no matter how long my hair had gotten. Didn't expect such a substandard product from Philips on their flagship rotary shaver. And, guess what? The original RQ12s are now selling on Amazon and eBay for over $160 for just the head! There's like this black market for the RQ12s. Philips, do that right thing, recall this crappy product, and just bring the old heads back. That's it! Or, you'll have one less loyal customer.
  1039. Tried these as a replacement for my Senso Touch 3D. My one year old used genuine original 3D blades were better than this new version replacement. New ones were quite uncomfortable and could not deliver nearly as good a shave result as the prior version. I will not &#34;upgrade&#34; to the 9000 series since they also use these &#34;new&#34; version blades.
  1040. Extremely disappointing. I plan to buy a different brand of electric razor!!!!! Loved the old head which is way too expensive for what you get!!
  1041. I used the old version for two years and I was afraid to buy this new one after reading the horrible reviews.<br />I find them very comparable, no change in blade quality, shaves well.<br />The mechanism to clean the blades has changed but this replacement head i just fine.<br />I really don't understand why the other customers are so unhappy.
  1042. UPDATE: The heads wore out after 6 months, not 12 like the package and Norelco state, and after 6 months, the shave hurt. To make matters worse, the plastic cover broke and I'm having difficulty finding a replacement because the stated replacement only fits the RQ12, not the RQ12+. I like the new design, but it's frustrating they didn't last. These are expensive to be replaces every 6m. I don't get it. There's so much hatred towards this replacement head with people saying it's noisy, harder to clean, doesn't cut as well, blah blah blah. Is this an upgrade from the original RQ12? Not really. It is a more than suitable replacement? Definitely. Look, my old RQ12 head was duller than a butter knife. I popped this one on, and it was like a brand new razor. I don't think that's any harsher pulling than the old head. It's a LITTLE noisier, but come on, you're shaving for a couple minutes as most per day, so it's not like it's going to give you hearing damage. I find that this head traps my hair better than the old RQ12, which just dumped hair out everywhere and made a mess on the counter and sink. With the new design, more hair is collected in the head and less on my bathroom counter. I think it's a wash as to which is easier to clean, the old flip up heads were more convenient, but this design isn't bad. Bottom line, I wouldn't believe the one and 2 star reviews, this is a solid performer and I think it's great Norelco is back to replaceable shaving heads and combs rather than having to replace the whole head assembly. Of course, if you want to spend 3x and buy an original RQ12, go right ahead.
  1043. This RQ12+ shaver head replacement works very well. After reading all the very negative reviews, I didn't know whether to get this replacement head or invest in a new shaver. I decided to take a chance on the RQ12+. Yes, it has more plastic parts than the original shaver head, and feels flimsier, and doesn't flip up for cleaning like the original. But it shaves just fine, much better than my original that had gotten dull from use. And it's not difficult to clean - cleaning is different from the original, but maybe better results. I am very satisfied with the RQ12+. (For a lot more details about this, see the review by Viper Tech dated Jan13, 2015. I agree with Viper Tech.)
  1044. The replacement head works fine. The only issue I have is one of the three orange rings that holds the blades in place is defective and keeps coming off. I have tried switching it around to different positions but it continues to dislodge. I have tried to find a replacement for it, even from Philips, but no one sells just that part. I have to buy a whole new replacement head again. Wish there was an option...
  1045. Good product, fast Delivery, Thanks!!
  1046. This head was hard to confirm that it was for my razor model, but I took a chance and it fit easily and delivers a smooth and quiet shave. My previous razor head broke completely, so the razor was not usable. It is now, and I am very pleased.<br /><br />I had to update this as in cleaning the razor, I took the rotating cutting head out of one of the head cylinders; putting it back together has proven impossible, despite following instructions and using the tool that was sent. I delayed replacing it, as I was convinced that I could reassemble. I have to give up, spend more time reinserting parts than it takes to shave. I still like it, just don't follow instructions to take it apart to clean.

  1050. Sorry Norelco. You really blew it on this one. This suppose to be the replacement for my RQ12 blade to use for my Norelco SensoTouch 3D. I use my razor wet for shaving my head. It use to take me about 5-8 mins to do my head and face. Now, with this blade, it takes 5 times longer because I have to keep going over and over the same spot for it to cut it all the way to the skin. I've call Norelco to complain, and they say, of well, &#34;sorry&#34;. We'll let customer service know. Sadly, I have a $100+ razor that now doesn't work properly. Sure, you can find the old RQ12 replacements if you want to spend $150. Come on Norelco, bring back the RQ12 blade replacement or I'll have no choice but to start looking at a different brand. Update: 3/26/15 Using this blade for almost 2 months now, I'm becoming more and more frustrated with it. My SensoTouch 3D is no longer considered a &#34;wet&#34; razor because this RQ12+ doesn't work wet. Now, all I can do is shave dry and take over 4 times longer to shave than I use to. I'm waiting patiently for Norelco to come back out with the old RQ12 blade. If not, I will have no choice but to find another brand. Any recommendations? Update: 4/16/15 Don't waste your time waiting for Philips Norelco to bring back the original RQ12 replacement blade. Go purchase a Panasonic ES-LV81-K Arc5 Electric Shaver Wet/Dry with Multi-Flex Pivoting Head and Automatic Cleaning System for Men. I did, and it's the best shave I've had in years. I used it for the 1st time last night over my head (I'm bald) and face, and it's the closet shave I've ever had with an electric razor. It was just as close as a regular blade. It cost a bit, but it is totally worth it. I will never go back to a Philips Norelco razor because of what they did with the RQ12 replacement blade.

  1055. First, I do agree with a lot of people on here...It's sub-optimal construction for a major company like this (feels and looks &#34;cheap&#34; and yet costs about the same as the old head), significantly more painful if you don't shave every day, takes more passes to get all the hair than previous model, less convenient to clean, etc.) And yes, I'm disappointed in Norelco for making this change.<br />However, it's not ALL bad. This new one definitely holds the cut hairs a lot better. (Old model, I had to stand over the sink to not make a mess. New one, I can wander around while shaving.) And I'm hoping the fact that you only change the blades and not the entire head will translate to lower cost of ownership.<br />So it has some redeeming qualities. But, overall, compared to the older head, I would certainly say I'm disappointed in Norelco.

  1057. I am very disappointed in this blade. When I first received it, it shaved really well. However, the quality decreased incredibly fast. I started hearing grinding noises while shaving and needed to spend a considerable amount more time shaving, just to get all the hairs. The ease of cleaning issue really didn't bother me too much. However, the original RQ12 was a nicer process. I am very happy with Amazon though. Since it shaved well at first, I didn't hang onto the packaging. They still took it back and gave a full refund! I am going to try out a Braun Series 7 which is a shame, since I really liked my 1280x. There is also no guarantee I will like the Braun anyway. I am using my worn out RQ12 blade while i am waiting for the Braun to arrive. I must say, my worn out RQ12 shaves better than the 3 week old RQ12+. The whole thing is frustrating and I have written Norelco a couple times about it. They have stated, they are not going to be addressing the issue. It really doesn't seem fair for me to have to invest in a new razor when I have one that works just fine. I just need a new blade of equal quality to the original. This blade was a bad call made by Norelco.ling with on the original design.

  1063. When I bought my SensoTouch 3D razor (with the factory RQ12 head), I thought it was the best razor I ever had. After 18 months, I figured it was time to replace the head.
